Package ohos.utils

Class ObjectAttribute<O,T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.utils.ObjectAttribute<O,T>

  • public abstract class ObjectAttribute<O,T>
extends Object
    An abstract class of object attributes.

    The ObjectAttribute class has the following characteristics:

    • You can override the get(java.lang.Object) and set(java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object) methods to implement general-purpose setter and getter methods, thereby making the code cleaner.
    • References to object attributes are flattened. For example, object A needs to hold a reference to object B to access one of its attributes, but object B has multiple other attributes that should be hidden from object A. In this case, you can use the ObjectAttribute class to encapsulate only the accessible attribute of object B and transfer it to object A.
    • You can override the set(java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object) method to set an object attribute to read-only.
    Since:
    2

      A constructor used to create an ObjectAttribute instance based on the specified attribute type and name.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public abstract T get​(O obj)
        Obtains the attribute value of a specified object. This attribute is the one encapsulated in the current ObjectAttribute object.
        Parameters:
        obj - Indicates the object to be accessed.
        Returns:
        Returns the value of the attribute encapsulated in the current ObjectAttribute object.

      • set

        public void set​(O obj,
                T value)
        Sets the attribute value of a specified object. This attribute is the one encapsulated in the current ObjectAttribute object.
        Parameters:
        obj - Indicates the object to be accessed.
        value - Indicates the attribute value to set.

      • isReadOnly

        public boolean isReadOnly​()
        Checks whether the attribute encapsulated in the current ObjectAttribute object is read-only.

        If true is returned, an UnsupportedOperationException exception will be thrown when you call the set(java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object) method.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the attribute is read-only, indicating that the attribute value cannot be updated by the set(java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object) method.

      • getName

        public String getName​()
        Obtains the name of the attribute encapsulated in the current ObjectAttribute object.
        Returns:
        Returns a string representing the attribute name.

      • getAttrType

        public Class<T> getAttrType​()
        Obtains the type of the attribute encapsulated in the current ObjectAttribute object.
        Returns:
        Returns the type of the attribute encapsulated in the current ObjectAttribute object.
